Package coreapi

Class Card

  • java.lang.Object
    • coreapi.Card
  • public class Card
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that represents the users' university card with its associated card number, DNI of the user to which it belongs and balance.
    Author:
    Fran, Marï¿½a, Borja

      Constructors

      Card​(int dni, int cNumber)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Card

        public Card​(int dni,
            int cNumber)
        Create new Card instances, with the associated card number and DNI of the corresponding user.
        Parameters:
        dni - DNI of the user to whom the university card belongs.
        cNumber - associated card number, this is unique.

    • Method Detail

      • getBalance

        public java.math.BigDecimal getBalance()
        Returns the card balance associated with a specific card.
        Returns:
        the balance associated with this card.

      • addBalance

        public void addBalance​(int cNumber,
                       java.math.BigDecimal bAdded)
                throws WrongTransactionException
        Add the balance desired by the card user to the card.
        Parameters:
        uDni - DNI of the user to whom the university card belongs.
        cNumber - associated card number, this is unique.
        bAdded - amount of balance to add to the card.
        Throws:
        WrongTransactionException - If the operation to be performed fails because the data entered is incorrect.

      • deleteBalance

        public void deleteBalance​(int uDni,
                          int cNumber,
                          java.math.BigDecimal bPay)
                   throws WrongTransactionException
        Eliminate a certain amount of balance to the card of the certain user.
        Parameters:
        uDni - DNI of the user to whom the university card belongs.
        cNumber - associated card number, this is unique.
        bPay - amount of balance to withdraw.
        Throws:
        WrongTransactionException - If the operation to be performed fails because the data entered is incorrect.
